PanoramaImage¶

Returns the panorama image

Size¶

The image panorama shape

adaptive_smoothing(panoramaImage, phenomena_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

Adaptive smoothing of range image according to another (self) panorama image

Note

The function is implemented similar to other smoothing functions (e.g., cv2.GaussianBlur; cv2.Blur), so different kinds of smoothing functions will be applicable by sending (without if). This means that the function will return computed sigma and ksize according to the average - and they will be returned in the variable.

An adaptive smoothing is implemented as a family of convolution kernels characterized by different \(\sigma\) values where:

\[d(\rho )=\frac{D}{\rho \Delta }\]

with :math: D, the object-space size of the window, and :math: Delta the angular sampling resolution and :math: rho is the measured range.

[Ara13]

Todo

Add optionality for adaptive smoothing for other properties panoramas, where adaptation is according to range information

Parameters:
  • phenomena_size – the minimal size of the phenomena that we don’t want to smooth (:math: D above) default: 0.12 m
  • panoramaImage – the image to smooth
Returns:

  • smoothed image
  • mean sigma size
  • mean kernel size
Return type:

tuple

normals(phenomenaSize=0.2, ksize=(5, 5), gradientType='L1', **kwargs)[source]¶

Computing gradients and normals in each direction, via adaptive smoothing according to [Ara13]

Parameters:
  • phenomenaSize – phenomena size for adaptive smoothing (default: 0.12 m)
  • ksize – kernel size for gradient computation (default: (5,5))
  • gradientType – ‘L1’ L1 norm of grad(I); ‘L2’ L2-norm of grad(I); ‘LoG’ Laplacian of gaussian (default: ‘L1’)

Optionals

Parameters:
  • rangeThresh (float) – scanner’s maximum range
  • smoothing_function – if other smoothing than adaptive is required (e.g. ‘guassianBlur’))
Returns:

  • normals: a holding \(n\times m \times 3\) ndarray of the normals in each direction (Nx, Ny, Nz)
  • gradient: gradient in each pixel
  • filtered: range image after adaptive smoothing
  • xyz: points’ list after smoothing, from range image
Return type:

tuple

Warning

Implemented for gaussian filtering and adaptive filters. Other adaptations might be needed when using different methods for smoothing.

See also

method NormalsFactory.NormalsFactory.normalsComputation_in_raster()

row_indexes¶

The row index of each point

setValues(**kwargs)[source]¶

Sets values into the panoramaProperty object

Parameters:
  • panoramaData (np.array) – The data to be represented as a panorama (e.g. range, intensity, etc.). Default: range
  • rowIndexes (int) – The row indices of the points in the point set based on the elevation angles
  • columnIndexs – The column indices of the points in the point set based on the azimuth angles
  • minAzimuth (float) – The minimal azimuth value
  • maxAzimuth (float) – The maximal azimuth value
  • minElevation (float) – The minimal elevation value
  • maxElevation (float) – The maximal elevation value
  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The measurements’ angular resolution in the azimuth direction.
  • elevationSpacing (float) – The measurements’ angular resolution in the elevation angle direction

Note

For the Scanstation C10 the measurements’ angular resolution for both elevation and azimuth directions:

  • Low: 0.11 deg
  • Medium: 0.057 deg
  • High: 0.028 deg
  • Highest: TO ADD
void_data¶

Value set for void areas
